place_description: A brewery, coffee bar, American eatery & fermentation lab share their products all under one roof.

reviews_data.review_text: Great biscuits! Really fresh OJ. Love the outdoor seating. Plenty of shade.
I was there earlier today sitting outside and I asked them to extend their overhanging shades because of a light drizzle and the manager refused, terrible customer service.

One of my new favorites! They had an excellent sour beer. Food menu also very good with lots of homemade options and vegetarian options. I enjoyed the pimento mac and cheese and falafel wrap. Very dog friendly. Would definitely return.
Scott and Austin are the best <3 !!
Cat and Maddie are AWESOME!!!!!!!!
Beer was great,  food was good had chicken tenders.  Generous portions.  Fries a bit soggy.
Food was delicious! Service excellent! Atmosphere delightful. We'll definitely be back!
Great Saturday hangout
Fee was amazing! It was her first day and she made sure to remind us when our drinks were low!
Great time with great people!

We had an excellent evening at Suffolk Punch!  Destiny was our superstar waitress and she really stood out with great service and a bubbly personality.  The atmosphere was top notch, the wait time was less than we expected, and the food was delicious. We will definitely be returning!
Barrett was so kind and attentive to our table and our needs! We have had him a few times and it was such a pleasure! The food is also amazing :)
Eryn was fantastic!! She was very helpful with suggestions and made our visit to Suffolk South End amazing!!
Great brews and Eryn was so nice, attentive, and provided top notch service!

We had Eryn and Barett as our servers for a going away party.

They were FANTASTIC. Eryn was so attentive and provided fast service. We will totally come back.

The chicken tenders were 10/10. Definitely recommend.

Quisha with Offline - I went for Lunch and I ordered the Appel of my eye cocktail which was better than I expected could hardly taste the alcohol but I definitely know it was in there. I enjoyed the Daydream cheesesteak and side salad which was a great choice. The roll was so soft it just folded in my mouth.
Delicious brunch and great service!

I used to enjoy going to this place to wind down after work. Unfortunately on 2/14 i went down with some friends with my service dog to get a couple of drinks. For my luck and employee as soon as i syepped in told me i couldnt go inside the place. Which i have been multiple times woth my service dog and i i emphasized that service dogs are allowed everywhefe which is fhe law. He responded that he didnt care about that and i feel he had a racist attitude towards me and my peers which discriminated me. What a place to go

Shannon with Offline - The Philly cheesesteak on the pretzel was insanely good. The side salad (instead of fries) was a very good size and loved the chunky blue cheese. The chicken wrap was very meh, I wouldn't order it again. I got an orange creamsicle mocktail and it was delicious. Service at the bar was great.
Delicious food, great burgers, great drinks, great atmosphere. Brussel sprouts were great too
Great service and a fun staff. the way the staff interacted gave you the impression they didn't hate their jobs. refreshing to see on south end.
The beer was so good the food was fine

I love drinks but probably the worst staff of any brewery in Southend and there is tons of breweries. 3 visits now and every time we walk up to the bar the staff just ignores you or takes them 15 minutes to acknowledge your standing there.

The food and drinks here are great but the service is absolutely incredible! Thank you to Eryn and April for being so incredibly kind on a gloomy Monday and making our day great! And you can't beat their espresso martinis!
Excellent food and the beer was great! They have a small parking lot beside the brewery. Excellent service.  Perfect place to grab a meal before we headed to the convention center for a show.

Today was a "day" at work so I needed to get out and have a beer. And after driving around South End behind stupid Charlotte drivers, I definitely needed a beer. Suffolk Punch isn't at all hard to find, right off South Tryon and they have a dedicated parking lot. So that's just awesome.

We seated ourselves at the table and Erin came by to take our drink order. A mocktail for Mrs. K. and a pilsner for me and when she returned with the drinks, we ordered a "flatbread" that really is a pizza.

It did take a bit considering the restaurant was almost empty but it was worth it. Burrata and cherry tomatoes and a balsamic drizzle. Absolutely delicious and reasonably priced.

We were here for at least an hour and I feel a whole bunch of destressed. Will need to return as their Monday night special is half off on burgers!

I love coming to Suffolk punch! It's a great vibe. Great spot to come for lunch or grab a coffee in the morning. Love that you can scan a Toast QR code and order food & drinks for the table and pay your tab on your phone! They've got good specials on food & drinks and rotate their cocktail & beer menu so there's always something new to try.
This review was made in connection with a Toast promotion.

Fantastic brewery and restaurant! This was our first time in Charlotte, and we wanted a spot with good beer, good food, and a lot of options. We weren't sure of everyone's dietary restrictions, so this seemed like a good choice so folks could have veggie, gluten-free, and non-alcoholic options if needed. I'm so glad we chose Suffolk Punch! All of the food was delicious, and the beer was pretty darn good as well. Plus, the atmosphere was delightful. 10/10, would recommend.
food and service bad. drinks average. will not be returning

What do you want a brewery to be? This place has it all (other than being a dive). Good food, good beers, lots of seating options (inside, covered patio, outdoors) and lots of TVs to watch for games. Solid place!

This place is a really nice spot if you want to go for brunch + breakfast. I went on a Sunday and the outside patio was packed, so expect maybe to wait for a table if the weather is nice outside otherwise inside is usually pretty open.

My friends and I got the Big Bun Cinnamon roll and it was really good. I think if I really had to nit pick I would have wanted it to be more warmed up/ hot and then I think it would have made it taste even better. It was just barely warm/ at room temperature, but still tasted good nonetheless.

We also got their seasonal Cinnamon Toast Crunch cappuccino and their classic chicken biscuits. The chicken was season very well and the gravy was really tasty. The biscuit itself is different so I can see some people either not liking it as much or really love it.

Overall, everything tasted good and the waiters and staff were really nice and the overall restaurant had a nice atmosphere. Their parking lot is really small btw so you will need to plan maybe ahead to find some parking near by. I'd come back here again a solid 7.5/10.
Great brunch and breakfast bowl!!

We love this place. It serves my favorite "beer" which is really a sour called Jawripper. We are also fans of their system of ordering, just use the QR code and a food runner will deliver. No dedicated table servers. It's a great system.

Chill atmosphere, wide selection of drinks, and the food portions are great. I don't typically leave reviews but unfortunately, a few days ago I was in the restroom here and watched an employee leave a stall, pause, then decide to leave without washing her hands. Now I'm grossed out. Be careful if you're ordering food here.

Ordered the Sausage egg cheese biscuit and bacon egg and cheese biscuit. Both biscuits were cold and dry and we were seated right at the kitchen so we thought they would be hot at least. Can't attest to the taste of the biscuit but would not recommend that as a food option. The beer here is great as well as the people which is why I gave them a 3.

Not worth it. Food was mid beer was ok I mean it was cold but nothing set it apart from any other tap room in clt. Very confusing atmosphere not a great place to watch games as they where on the tvs but when asked to play it out loud it never happened. Just not my cup of tea I guess.
Great cold drinks!! Friendly place and vibe
Great place to have drinks

Best batter I've ever had on fish and chips. And at $20, this is an outstanding value. Special shout out for making good coleslaw which I find is unfortunately rare. Recommend offering a spicy version!

I got a cider (orange mango) and a sour ale (tropical tree tops) Best sour ale I've had in Charlotte. Cider was really good too. Recommend offering to-gos on ciders.

Service was friendly and courteous. Atmosphere has good lighting and is well decorated.

I highly recommend this place for solo, dates, groups, etc. Awesome food, drink, and people.

Male bartender was ok. Female was extremely polite. Had a great time overall. I'm an experienced beer drinker and the Pale ale was one of the best I've ever had. Food came as appetizers and was very good. Overall far better than most places.

I love this place! Perfect for well behaved dogs as they have ample outdoor seating and you order from your phone at the table! Drink menu is fantastic, lots of options between a big beer selection, cocktails, and coffee! All the food I've ordered has also been delicious.
Staff friendliness is lacking and service isn't matching the atmosphere and price. Have been three times in two weeks and service is mediocre at best.
Good food, just some delays with the online ordering system that they have to order your food at the table, but taste was good on the pork belly sandwich and the side salad.

One of my favorite places to hangout with friends in Charlotte. It has both indoor and outdoor seating with great ambiance. Love the food and drinks. Highly recommend the nachos and black bean burger for vegetarians.

Our go-to neighborhood haunt! Suffolk Punch has been a favorite of ours since it opened in 2017. It's conveniently located near our home and directly on the light rail, making it easy for anyone exploring Charlotte. They offer great upscale bar bites, weekly specials (like half-priced salads on Wednesdays), breakfast, a coffee bar, and in-house brewery options. The ambiance is consistently good and changes throughout the day, making it a perfect spot for remote work in the morning and a post-work drink in the evening.

Suffolk offers a refreshing atmosphere with a diverse crowd and a consistent, friendly staff who know us well. It's within walking or a quick driving distance of several other breweries, ideal for a brewery crawl, and has direct light rail access from the outdoor space. We visit with or without our kids for casual hangs and have had many business lunches here (and no, it doesn't feel like a playground like some breweries in CLT do). The back patio is very dog-friendly, great for people-watching, and the industrial warehouse space is beautifully decorated with hanging plants and a moody interior.

The best food! The best cocktails! The best patio vibes! Suffolk Punch is consistently amazing.

On my last visit, my sister and I ordered several plates to share - the Local Queen City Pretzel, the Warm Street Corn Dip, and the Strawberry Fields Salad. Everything was 10/10.

My Spicy Berry Margarita was delicious and refreshing. I was pleased to see they offered a mocktail option, which my sister ordered and said was awesome. We sat on the patio, which was the perfect spot to enjoy a sunny Sunday afternoon.

*UPDATE* Visited for brunch for the first time and was once again impressed! The chicken biscuit was amazing. I got it with a side salad, which was the perfect balance.

I'm a fan for life!

TOP TIER! Right off the light rail at the New Bern Station this brewery is amazing! Great craft beers on tap with a limited supply side pour, several bourbons, whiskeys and scotchs for you to try and on top of that a great venue to sit and enjoy some really great food! (The Mac n cheese is my fave so far!)

If you are in the South End area or taking a ride on the Cats Lynx, definitely stop at New Bern and give this place a try, I promise, you'll be back!
GOOD VIBE
Nice spot. Went there 1st in the morning so I just got tea which was really good. Staff was very nice
Good food good beer!

I love this place! My friends and I meet here often to catch up. I love how you scan the QR code and everything you order comes right to your table. Do not come here if you're looking for a dining experience because you will not find it. I love how this brewery is usually lively, but not so busy that it negatively impacts the quality of the food & drinks. The plants, design, & all the outdoor space is a huge plus.

Beer and cocktail options are great. There's a pretty big variety of both so everyone is was with found something they liked. Their food was tasty as well but their drinks are definitely what set them apart.

Came here for brunch and got Corned Beef Hash with a side of toast/grits and loved it! Cocktails were yummy too! Recommend the Strawberry Fields. Great food and great service, will definitely be back!!

Sat at the bar for two hours on Monday evening. Place was not busy at all. I couldn't find the bartender most of the time so I couldn't order another drink or anything to eat. If you're not a 20-something this place acts like they can't even see you.

One of our favorite places we've been in Charlotte by far! From the super sweet and friendly hostess (6 stars for you, honey!) to the wait staff, everything was awesome!  The fried chicken and French toast was to die for, best breakfast dish I may have ever had!!  Great vibes, great food, great drinks. Thanks for an awesome start to the day!

This spot is good for foodies and coffee lovers! I was especially happy to see the gluten-free options. I had a gluten free bread with shrimp. It was so good! Everyone can't make gluten free pizza , but this location has it down pack. The Parmesan fries were so good with the house made ketchup. My kids had a cinnamon crunch latte. You could smell how good it tasted. The kids have it a 4 out 5. When in Charlotte definitely stop here and grab a bite. PS: the customer service was superb!

Great lunch bites outdoors, even in the heat, the misters keep you cool. We tried the charcuterie, fries (with pesto=game changer!), whipped ricotta & tortillas... all yummy! Loved my beer & the selection of beverages. I'll be back.

This place was great. We're on vacation and weren't sure where to park, we were looking on the street but it actually has parking lots next to the building. We also were sure if the place was open or good because it looked too quiet. Turns out it had a super busy back patio area. The food we had was good, the beer I had was good, I'd definitely recommend going here.
Any place that serves crispy, ice-cold, glass-bottled Sprite(tm) gets the top spot. That and a shrimp and grits- presto change-o my hangover is gone.

We had a great experience at Suffolk Punch! There was a group of 5 of us who met here to celebrate a birthday. Drinks were great and all of our food items were amazing. Highly recommend the street corn dip app!! We also got a salad, burger, chicken sandwich, tacos, and veggie burger. 10/10 across the board. Service was fast and extremely accommodating. The staff here is awesome. Really good vibes all around.
There was also an incident where a man had wandered over (not a customer) and was making our group and a few others really uncomfortable. The staff quickly and respectfully took care of it.
We'll all definitely be back and will bring our husbands and kids next time!

Suffolk Punch is an absolute gem! My wife and I love coming here, especially for their brunch burger, which is simply to die for. The flavors are perfectly balanced, and it's always cooked to perfection.

But it's not just the food that keeps us coming back. We also love the atmosphere. Sitting outside and enjoying our meal while watching other people's adorable dogs is such a delight. It's like we get to live vicariously through their joyful energy.

The staff is always friendly and attentive, making sure we have a great experience every time. Suffolk Punch has definitely become our go-to spot for a relaxed and enjoyable brunch. Highly recommend!

Great food and drinks!
Professional staff, love the indoor and outdoor seating options. Music also not as loud so you can enjoy conversations without yelling through noise.
Will be coming back :)
Chicken and biscuits outstanding!!

It is always such a fun vibe at Suffolk! The food is amazing. The ordering system is so convenient. The space is beautiful!
I wish the weekday menu had more non-fried menu items.
Good food and drinks
Great food and service
It was nice! We ate outside on the patio being it was nice out. The food was amazing. Daydream Nachos were incredible! My cocktail was delicious! I will be going back for sure!!

"Suffolk Punch Brewery is an absolute gem! My recent visit left me in awe of their culinary and brewing prowess. The Suffolk Punch Brewing South Park burger was a flavor explosion - the Irish Oaks Grass Fed Beef paired perfectly with the fresh Bibb Lettuce, Tomato, Shaved Onion, and those unforgettable Drunken Pickles. And let's not forget about the ooey-gooey goodness of the cheddar cheese and SPG sauce, all nestled in a delightful local bun from QCP Co. Perfection on a plate!And as for their brews, the Work Horse pale ale citra was a revelation. It was hoppy, crisp, and refreshing - the ideal companion for a Thursday evening. And speaking of Thursdays, their $3 Thursday deal is an absolute steal!From the moment you step through the doors, you're greeted with warmth and hospitality. Suffolk Punch Brewery has definitely earned a permanent spot on my list of favorite spots in town. Can't wait for my next visit!"
Awesome brewery, right by the tracks, New Bern Station. Gets crowded at lunch, better enjoy a dinner.

It's a good brewery, but also stuck in between where it needs to figure out if it's a restaurant or a coffee shop or is it a brewery?  Beer is good but not great. Cool location though; good vibes; friendly staff.
It's very comfortable. The staff is outstanding. No long waiting.
Food was good service wasn't bad

Food was pretty decent, if a bit overpriced. Beer was good, with an acceptable array of hazy IPAs. Service was sub-par, took 8 minutes for any of the 4 employees hanging out behind the nearly empty bar to notice I was done. I probably would have ordered another beer, but instead called it quits. I would rate this place a solid...MEH.
Cold food.

The place is nice, but parking is hard to find; I seat outside and got a mimosa (horrible) and a burger my order said $28, and my credit card got charged $36. The food was ok but not for the price and the worst mimosa I have ever tried. I won't recommend this place to eat. The service was ok.

Great spot for some good food and good drinks on this side of town.  Their beers are superb , they also have some wine and enough liquors to make a majority of simple cocktails.  Food was on point.  I had the fish and chips and I'm not going to lie, that was some of the best I've ever had.  The fish was cooked perfectly, the batter for the fish was seasoned perfectly,  fries on point, and the slaw had jalapenos in it which was a nice twist.  They have a huge outdoor area so I can see this place getting packed on warm nights.  If you drive there I can see parking being an issue if it's going to be busy, but we were visiting - I'm sure the locals know the parking secrets.  Next time we're in CLT this will definitely be a destination!

Great place. Only complaint was with the outdoor area that is covered during the winter is extremely loud when busy. Personally not a fan of that, but the environment was great. Everyone was having a good time. Nice ordering system, drinks came quick. Restrooms had a line for the men's which was odd. nice place would come again but personal preference on a not so busy night.
Great drinks!!

My husband had the burger and brussel sprouts and really seemed to enjoy it. I ordered the chicken sandwich and fries and didn't even taste the sandwich. I found it so visually unappealing that I just wasn't interested in eating it. The fries were good and the beer was good. I'll for sure return but I'll probably just stick to sides and beer.
We were there for brunch. Food was very good, portions were very large.   Their drinking water was very clean and crisp,  I think it was filtered for making beer.

Literally sat inside for 10 minutes and no one came took our order. Skinny white girl was walking around attending other tables. Decided to go to the bar instead. A party of four sat on the previous table and she attended the table right away. I understand short staffing but not a good experience. Everyone is looking miserable here. No one is smiling. Not the same vibe as it used to be. Not asking for a lot.
I really enjoyed the customer service, drink, and the food was absolutely delicious.
Excellent food, excellent drinks, excellent service. Great place to split a flatbread with a friend and enjoy an amazing beer selection.
I am not pleased with this restaurant!! I order calamari  it was uncooked, for $19.00 !!! I'll not be back, I'll be tell my friends...

Honestly, everything else was perfectly fine but please don't claim to have a coat check when said "coat check" is just a rack where people steal whatever coat they would like. The $140 ticket was not worth my leather coat getting stolen.

l'll just say for me personally I only leave reviews for places if I'm like blown away with a place. With that I first off wanna say that Eryn an Nick are 2 baller bartenders. Eryn recommended the best flatbread sauce combo I've had in a while on top of the wings. And both Eryn and Nick gave me a few samples of beer til I found the one I liked!

On that note...the beer was fantastic. Every single one. And the food was unreal. To just get a flatbread and wings my girlfriend and I were blown away! Highly recommend!
Cute spot that has a good vibe. Their chicken biscuit is delicious (not pictured). Sadly, no turkey or chicken for substitution available (i.e. turkey or chicken sausage, etc).
Good food and drinks
Good food, nice service staff, no wait.
Maddie was an amazing bartender. She made our experience top shelf!
Maddie is the best server/bartender! She'll take care of you.

11/10/23 Lunch. We went to the Billy Graham Library and stopped at the Suffolk Punch for a late lunch.

We shared the Mac Attack (Bralsed Beef Short Rib, Aged Cheddar Mac-n-Checse, Jalapeno, Bayou nutalo, Crispy Onlons) and the KICKIN' CHICKEN NACHOS (Korean BBQ Chicken Thigh, Crispy Wonton Chips, Sambal Lime Aioli, Scallion, Cucumber, Jalapeno, Radish, Sesame Seed).

The nachos were great, but the Mac Attack was too heavy and greasy. The flavors didn't work well in my opinion. It was too wet and had too much Jalapeno. And my americano was luke warm. Not very good.

Overall, the meal was just ok.

Excellent: Uniquely satisfying. A special place.
Very Good: Better than expected.
Average: An everyday experience.  Just OK.
Fair: Below par. Dirty smells. & / or flies.
The Fruit Sour was awesome and the Tacos were great as well
Great salad, fish and Hoppy IPA. Both of us enjoyed a 4 sample flight. Very fine Brewpub.
This place is fantastic! Nicely appointed interior with a lovely bar. Fabulous selection of beer. We got IPA flights that were most enjoyable. Beautiful menu as well.

Hmm first off, seat yourself, enter all personal information into toast app database (if you don't have Apple Pay, can't wait for new slew of toast emails and personal data sold)...next order bland chicken biscuits with no seasoning. They weren't stingy on the dehydrated hash browns which was nice. Chase someone down for Tabasco, get a small cup of "Louisiana HOT SAUCE" while getting scowled at by service staff. If you want regular coffee before your meal or during the meal, good luck. FYI basic black coffee is called a "batch brew" out of their fifty choice options. Overall, brunch was mid, service very poor but we did get our food and able to leave within 30 minutes.

TLDR: brunch for geriatric and bland people

Side bar: Electronic ordering is fine, even McDonalds has incorporated it into operations...but at least you get your coffee on a Sunday morning in less than 5 minutes.

What was supposed to be a small after-wedding brunch turned into a large family gathering and I am so glad we decided to go to Suffolk Punch. I panicked when I saw all of my guests arriving but the staff at SP didn't even blink an eye. They were even kind enough to squeegee off the tables after it had rained all morning. The food came out quickly, the staff was extremely friendly, and every one of our guests was thrilled we picked Suffolk Punch for brunch.
Great service and our waitress Maddie was attentive and personable with a quick wit and bubbly personality
Server Maddie was awesome! Great food, beer, and service!
Fries and beef patty were very very salty, if I ate the burger I would have had high blood pressure, my health is more important so I didn't eat it. Server was nice.

We had such a great time! The atmosphere was perfect and the food and beer were awesome! We were celebrating my birthday and we wanted a place to hang out and talk!! It was the perfect evening. Maddie was our waitress and she was wonderful! She told us that she could make a killer espresso martini and she didn't dissapoint!
Went for weekend brunch and we all loved the food! The shrimp & grits was a favorite. Great beer and atmosphere too! Will definitely be back.

Is a pretty relaxed setting, however, would recommend just sticking to drinks and avoiding the food. Quality was not great.

However, Brandon was very nice with finding a solution.
We were charged $14 for a Martini that was $7 the week before.  Make sure to check the price list before they take your eyes out.
Please remove coffee from the menu taste really bad look how light it is . Everythingelse is fine

Love this place. Food is great, and their beer selections and drinks are excellent.  They are getting 4 because my favorite item on the menu is only during brunch.

Chicken biscuit!

Although this was my first visit, I am hoping it will not be my last! The drinks, food AND staff were amazing!! With only having tried one food menu item myself, the Chicken Biscuit, it was delicious. Friends that accompanied me were also very pleased with their food choices. And the beer selections were incredible. The staff was very attentive, pleasant and friendly. A definite A++. I highly recommend!! I look forward to my next visit!
Had such an amazing time here as always. Best food and I love their sours so much! The hostess Rebecca was so kind and accommodating and really made for a great experience. Thank you guys!

Food & beer is reasonably good. Very disappointing unfriendly service. If you enjoy drinking your $7 beer out of a plastic cup & eating your $18 entree with cheap plastic wear, this place might be for you.

Great atmosphere and local music but stay away from the over priced mixed drinks. The first drinks were margaritas and they were terrible and 27 dollars for 2 drinks. The second drinks were amaretto sours and a Jameson and
Ginger ale. They used Ginger beer instead of ginger ale it was aweful and agin very expensive.
Nice place. Lively. Breakfast bowl was pretty good. Dont sub the grits for the potatoes. They're really good. This area has really changed. I dig the vibe.

I really enjoyed eating brunch at this location! The food was amazing and the staff was very friendly and welcoming! It was great to go down the light rail trail to see more of what Southend has to offer! Highly recommend stopping here if you're in Charlotte!

Major win for singles or families of all ages if you enjoy a good brew, unique eats and rustic industrial yet hoppin atmosphere. Our service was excellent too, setting itself apart with our waitress being incredibly genuine - thanks Maddie!  The patio looked nice but we didn't explore with the 93F weather outside. We stopped here randomly after 7 hours driving with our 3 year old (beach bound) and really needed a chill breather. Major win.
Suffolk is the best! Our waitress Star is 10/10. We had the best night and she made great recommendations for us to try. Will definitely be back soon!

Had a great time at the Suffolk Punch tonight. Our server Star was incredible and the food/drinks were perfect. Suffolk has been my favorite spot in South End for the past five years and never disappoints. The food, drinks, atmosphere, and service are among the best in the entire city.

Food and drinks were delicious. Maddie, our server honestly made the meal great though. She was really sweet and funny and helped my nephew have a good time! Would definitely come back for Maddie alone!

Things have changed: the cold brew martini was mostly Bailey's, not up to usual. The staff this morning was more interested in chatting with each over than service (Not crowded, no excuse).
Brussels sprouts were undercooked, all food just wasn't nearly as good as usual.

New In town and wanted to check out a brewery. Solid selection of beers including some interesting fruited sours. The flatbreads were great. Maddie was our server and was A+. Attentive, pleasant, and fun. I'll be coming back for sure, may end up being my neighborhood spot.
We had Maddie tonight and she was the best!! So sweet and didn't miss a beat. Would definitely come back just to have her be our waitress. She made our dinner so enjoyable!
Great service, yummy food, cool cocktails!
Went to South End, Richard went above and beyond with customer service!! Kind, helpful, understanding. 10/10 recommend! Thanks for the great experience!

This past Friday, myself and a group of friends met for dinner at the south end SP location. I ordered from the QR code on the table since they do not have servers that come around to take your order. I ordered from my phone one beer to start totaling $7.58. I immediately closed the tab for that one beer, leaving a $0 tip bc there's no server. I ordered a second beer, same beer ($7.58) and same process. Ordering from my phone and closing out immediately. Today Tuesday (four days later) it just posted to my account and I was charged $8.58 for my first beer and $9.10 for my second beer. I have all the receipts to prove. Unfortunately I can not get anyone on the phone to resolve this issue. LADIES AND GENTLEMEN DO NOT COME HERE YOU WILL BE SCAMMED! If you do choose to come, always ask for a receipt and check your bank statements. This is disgusting to think they would do this and how many people they do it to and get away with it!
Great food, service and beer as usual! Suffolk is a sleeper work from home, outside of home, spot
Cervejaria bacana em Charlotte

Worse place I have ever eaten.   Why should we be expected to tip when we have to do all the work. I dislike the do it yourself ordering. We were not able to get what we wanted because there were no direction. We ordered two burgers but wanted different side. We both got the same sides because we were unaware that to get different sides you needed to place two separate orders.
One of my top lunch spots in Charlotte. Their burgers are some of the best you can get in town and goes great paired with their delicious selection of brews.
Beers were awesome, staff was awesome and friendly. First time here and will be back.
The south end location was a nice atmosphere with outside seating. we are inside but the food was amazing and fresh. I had the Cider on tap that was superb. I would definitely be back!
Maddie was fantastic, fun! Energetic and very attentive. We will be back to see her!
Maddie was amazing. Drinks and beers were great. Looking forward to being her in-laws.
Great brunch and beer! And excellent coffee!
Hot chicken excellent, burger so so. Tuna nachos very tasty but toppings covered 1/4 chips at best. Salad with "heirloom tomatoes had ONE cherry tomato, about 4 bites.
Great food. Nice outdoor seating. Staff friendly and helpful. Took wife and kids this morning for brunch. Will definitely go back. Chicken biscuit, shrimp n grits, and drinks are amazing.

Best place ever to go for my birthday! Leo made my birthday one of the best ever! Can't recommend this place enough. If you want to have a FAN FU@kingtastic time on your birthday go down to Suffolk Punch Brewing and ask for my guy LEO!!!!!
Always a fantastic experience at Suffolk Punch! Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere. I do miss their fans in the outside seating area.

I had a memorable experience here over the weekend, unfortunately not for a good reason. On Saturday, we went to grabe some brunch. We were seated promptly, but our waitress seemed to not be able to look at us, AT ALL!! Now I thought she might have just been a little bit off that day... but we watched how she interacted with every other table she had, and it was a completely noticeable difference. The only difference was we were the only black people seated at that time. It was obvious to my whole group. It was very awkward and made us very uncomfortable.  We ended up ordering mimosas and leaving shortly after.  Needless to say, we will not be making another trip there. Hopefully, this was just that individual, and i hope anyone else that looks like me will not have to encounter this waitress.
Good food and good beer

Went to this place yesterday. Food is good that's the only reason I gave them 2 starts. Now, the service...that's a different story. Every server I interacted with looked  mad and like they hated their job, so they provided a very mediocre service. Not friendly and/or welcoming to say the least. At one point it got so uncomfortable, that I just left. Not going back, and do not recommend. Good Customer service is a priority to me, and they do not offer that.
Edit, went back and servers we're lovely, so in fairness I am changing the review.
Went on a Saturday and had a great experience! Our server Maddie was the BEST! super attentive and friendly. Will be returning.
The pimento cheese deviled eggs were good, the pretzel was hard. The beer was good, really liked the sour option
Yummy food and good vibes. Definitely coming back!!
Food and drinks are great and good atmosphere. However they didn't let me into the main restaurant because I have a service dog and had to sit in the rain or the outside barn area

First time going and it's a fun place to hang out for a casual drink with friends or quick bite with family. It was pricey, considering the drinks are served in plastic cups and you have to grab cheap plastic cutlery to eat food with (if you eat outside). The kids meals are over $7. Ended up being $100 for two adults and 2 kids under 5.
I loveee this place but the food I've had the last few times have been mediocre especially the ahi tuna tacos would not recommend ordering that

Update to my review:
The general manager reached out to me and has been very communicative and kind. I think this was just an unfortunate event for the restaurant and the staff was not well prepared with how to advise customers and provide good customer service while dealing with the mishap.

We had lunch at the new South Park location; very hip and fun since it's right at the mall... great outdoor seating. The crispy brussels sprouts were DEEEEE-LISH, we also had the White BBQ  Chicken flatbread, truffle fries and Japanese BBQ tacos- everything was yummy and perfect sizes for sharing. Reasonable prices for lunch as well.  The Rose Mule and the Boulvadiere Old Fashioned were great too!
Best bar i have ever been too. MANAGER kitty was so accomadating 10/10
Spacious and customer friendly.
Wow!  Something uniquely different and delicious at the same time.  Great atmosphere and service was amazing.  The Burrata-Rita caprese flatbread is to die for!  Definitely be back.
South Park Location- Brandon was nothing short of AMAZING. He knew the menu really well. The food was really good as well. Definitely will be coming back.
Great food and beer.  Love the outdoor patio

I'm on a mission to find the best biscuit and pretzel anywhere.  It is not here.  The biscuit was more like a dry cake and the pretzel was too thin and the cheese was flavorless. The atmosphere was great and this would be a great afternoon hangout, inside or out. Parking is terrible though so I probably won't be back.

My fraternity brother from out of town was visiting, and we went to Suffolk Punch for lunch.  It was a Wednesday afternoon, and we sat at the bar.  This is one of the best breweries in Charlotte because they have great beer and delicious food.  The staff is very friendly, and even one of the brewers talked to us about which IPA we liked the best.  We split the Ahi Tuna Tacos and the Krabby Patty, which is a crab cake.  The food was great, and I love their fries too.  I have been to almost every brewery in Charlotte, and Suffolk Punch is one of the best.
Good brewery and nice place to hangout. Best part is you can order beer and food from table.
Good customer service and cool vibe.
Good place to visit

This is a nice place to have a relaxing brunch! We came on a Saturday around 10:30 AM. Plenty of outdoor seating with chill music that's not too loud. You seat yourself...to order and pay you scan a barcode on the table. We got the chicken and gravy biscuit which was good...it's a little expensive but you get a lot of food. We also got the bacon, egg and cheese biscuit which was also good...although a little cold. Very fast service! As far as drinks go we got a hot chai tea latte and an iced nitro cold brew with hex coffee. Both were good along with reasonable prices. We will be coming back!
Great beer and nachos. Enjoyed being there on a Friday night, would recommend this place.
Good food and drink, lots of seating. You just might need to get creative on where to park.
Favorite place to eat when I visit Charolette

My wife and I have been here a few times over the last year and a half. The first time we came in July 2021 the food was impressive and not too expensive. However, the last two times we have come here the food is not as good as it used to be and the prices have gotten ridiculous. We were here on Sunday for brunch with two people ordered 3 small plates of food and 4 drinks and total bill was over $150 and both my wife and I had stomach issues after eating here.

I guess this place has become too popular for its own good. Likely won't be back anytime soon.
Mac and cheese flatbread is more pizza shaped and delicious! Definitely a more unique take. I went during a calmer time and the server was attentive and friendly just like the other staff.
Awesome brunch spot! Food was delicious and staff was super friendly! Will be back soon  pictured are: Breakfast sampler, chicken biscuit, and quinoa vegetable hash (yummy!!)
One of the coolest, places I've ever been in Charlotte. The beers were incredible, the atmosphere was great, that outdoor area is so nice. So many cute dogs everywhere
The service at Suffolk Punch is great. The food comes out very quickly and the wait staff is attentive. Order the breakfast bowl with the breakfast potatoes! You won't regret it!
Amazing spot with outdoor seating.  Really enjoyed my time there and trying the wide selection of unique beers.  Great afternoon spot

I just had the Daydream in the can (Helles Lager) and it was phenomenal! I looked up your website and I was surprised you also make one of my favorite pilsners the Blue Daisy.. it all makes sense! Keep up the great work!

Coffee bar review only: Meh. Coffee was okay. Tried the February specials (red velvet latte and strawberry shortcake latte) with oatmilk. Lattes weren't too sweet, Coffee flavor was non- existent and the drinks were lukewarm. Were told the drinks were 16oz but only 12oz. Service was not good. Hopefully they do a better job with beer and food service.
Food and beer was amazing

This place rocks, and it is super popular because of it! They have delicious beer, great bartenders, great service, and GREAT food. I've had the burrata pizza, and I've also had some of the handhelds. My TOP recommendation is the Alabama slammer with fried chicken, there is nothing like it. Overall, great vibe and a great place to grab a beer or watch a game with friends. They also get really busy on the weekends and I believe they host live music in the venue/stage next to the main building. They're literally right at the New Bern light rail stop so theres no issue with parking!
Wow..

Let me just start by saying the food? WAS AMAZING. Being an CLT Offline Member, I'm prepared to try all the things from the recommendations I get matched with each month! Of course we ordered the Chicken Biscuit and also got a side of the cheesy grits which were PHENOMENAL. Coffees were also great during the cold rainy day we were having. Also got some little treats that were displayed at the front register area. What I wasn't a fan of was the service. No one greeted us when we walked in (except the fellas in the back by the beer) and upon reviewing the menu, my partner and I felt rushed and as if we were an inconvenience.  No one came to see if we needed anything our entire meal and no one attempted to tell us to have at the least a "day" when we left. Overall....would I visit again? For the food - Yes!! but if I have the same rude vibes, it will more than likely be the last time.
Good spot to drink but food has gone way downhill while going way up in price. Will purposefully eat before going here so I don't have to spend 20-25 bucks on average to below average food

Used to like this place, but they've changed. No longer a laid back place to chill.Just getting through the door is a hassle now.

Won't be going back.

Brunch was overpriced and pretty awful - $45 for a stale chicken biscuit and some greasy salty grits. Maybe it was a one-off bad experience, but I was not impressed at all with the food. Beer was fine.

Nice place and accommodating waitress. However, $51 for 2 burgers and 1 cocktail is absolutely ridiculous.  The burgers were ordered medium but, came overcooked and tough. Could tell they were either smashed into a ring or frozen. It's not that hard to hand pat burgers. The bloody mary was bland, but had plenty of vodka in it. For $12, it should. The fries were great though.
Overall great place -- but most recent visit,  service from waitress was poor and the dirty martini was absolutely foul

In town for Christmas,went there with family,very disappointed with food,ordered a pizza,nachos,fries,and cauliflower for the table,fries were good,rest was below average,exp for price,main courses were also fair at best.for the price,expected a much better lunch
Great atmosphere

Service on a Saturday night at 7pm was fast, efficient, and polite. The bartender bought my friend's first drink because we were there celebrating her birthday. Great bar food that comes out fast and accurate. I haven't been in a long time, but I will definitely be back more frequently after tonight.

Price increase here has been pretty bad lately. It used to be reasonable and now it's just outrageous. Stuff that originally was 9 bucks is now 15.

Don't get me wrong I get inflation, but Suffolk is milking this to the T.
Spot is very good for Thursdays, and has a really cool vibe to it. That still is going for it.
Awesome vibes and tasty coffee! Good spot to watch sporting events (World Cup games or football) and a space I'll definitely come back to outside with my pup!
Sweet vibes, beer is solid, try a Tree Top or a Daydream, food great.  Brussel Sprouts best in town...local spot, good for sports
Great service, great people and great atmosphere.

We had a party of 6 at 8:00 pm on Friday, 11/4/22. It was packed, but we were able to find a table outside! Suffolk is huge and so pretty. Great venue. Love the string lights. There was a band playing as party of Suffolk Punch's Daydream Music Fest.

We ordered through a QR code on our table. Service was so quick!!

Here's what I tried:
- Grains and Things ($16): Large portion. Loved the ingredients. But the chicken was a little difficult to cut and there was too much goat cheese for my taste. Still good though!
- Fungus Among Us ($16): OMG. So much flavor. So delicious.
- Crispy Brussels ($6): Good!
- Mac-N-Cheese ($6): Yummmm, currently craving this.

Suffolk Punch was awesome! Good for groups, date night, anything! Highly recommend!
order on phone, fast service for both the bar and kitchen! pet friendly too.

I travel and try to always stop at a local brewery. The staff here was rude, if they even had time to  acknowledge I was at the bar. Beer was warm and when I tried to ask questions of the bartender he was incredibly condescending . There are better options in this area .
Warm beer and lack of polite service will keep us from coming back.
Absolutely loved this place!  Gathered friends for  brunch on an early October day and the weather was amazing paired with the food and drinks.  Definitely will be back here, highly recommend.

Beers are pretty good but that fish and chips is the best fried fish I've ever had in my life.  Not sure if they marinated the fish or if it was something in the batter but it blew me away.  Anybody can make "good" fried fish, but this was on another level.

Great food, great atmosphere, great staff. I had the Asiago truffle fries, chips& spinach/artichoke dip, SP lemonade and the grains & things salad. The salad was healthy and uniquely delicious. I can't wait to come back and order it again
Such an amazing brewery, cannot express how amazing the staff, food, and drink is! I Will always stop in whenever I'm in Charlotte
Best Bar tender everrrr!

Wow, what good food. This place is a really cool place to eat with amazing food. I would love to come back again and check this place out again.
The atmosphere was amazing with very good staff that did an amazing job, even during the busy Brunch time

My breakfast bowl was delicious!
I also had the Beach Boii cocktail.
It was amazing!
Nice vibe! Fish n chips were tasty! Good service!

If your looking for a great atmosphere, food, and customer service. This is my second time in less then a week. My first time was for my Anniversary ,and my second time was a Mother and Daughter date. I was so excited to have Cayley as our waitress for the second time. She is very sweet, has a great sense of humor, and had great food recommendations for us.
I highly recommend Suffolk Punch and don't forget to ask for Cayle!
Had the SPB burger.  It was fantastic. I was impressed by the server as she took orders for 5 of us without writing down the order!  The fries were great as well.
This was my first visit. Half price bottles of wine on Tuesday's. Star was the best, loved her style and recommendations

Great place to have a beer (or 4)
The service was awesome and the food flavorful. The only downside for me was the booth seating. I'm 6'5" and my wife is 6' and this was the only seating available for us.
Brunch

Really good food and a great place in general. We had to sit outside despite the rain, but the service outside was quicker than most restaurants I've ever been to. You get to order through an app and keep your tab open. Beers come out within a minute or too which is really impressive considering how busy it is. The food is a little pricy, but it's really good. We had the spinach artichoke dip which I really recommend, the thai chili flat bread, and the burger. Pay attention to the menu because the carmalized onion jam has strawberries. I also super appreciate the compostable cutlery. The beer was really good as well. The IPAs as well as the seltzers and the frozen slushie drinks. Not really a bad thing to say!

Great outdoor seating. Band playing on Friday night. Industrial style bar inside. Burgers salads small bites typical bar food. Very good. Great brussels sprouts. Had a miscommunication with the waitress. She didn't tell us there was an up charge for Brussel sprouts. Jordan, manager made it right, did all the right things will definitely be back and spread the word,
Phenomenal food and great business hours, even open early on weekdays for coffee, beer, or breakfast!

Beautiful spot. Always clean which is great. Ordered food to go and no one brought the food to me or let me know the food was ready. The food was super dry and tasted so bad. Would never eat here again.
We stopped in for lunch. Food was good but seems a little on the pricey side for me. $16 hamburger and fries is a bit much for what you get.

Popular brewery in the South End area. Large taproom/ outside patio. Beers are mostly solid craft brews, some very good, some not so. Varied inventive food menu, no basics. Service is friendly, but I found it challenged. At the bar either 5 or 6 people were tripping over each other or you would not see a bartender in sight. Some lacked a welcoming personality. Trevor was the bright spot of the bunch. When weather permits, the outside patio with dedicated bar works great. Very nice coffee bar is a plus. Parking can be a challenge on weekends. Take the light rail, station at the back door
The vibe is nice and food is amazing!! The thai pork is unbelievable. The shrimp taco's were not my favorite.

first time here, beautiful place, great beer selection, bar staff not that attentative. Sat with an empty beer for a good while with multiple people behind the bar not asking me for another beer. Would've loved another beer but I'm not fond of the idea of chasing staff down to get service. Sat for almost 30mins with no beer or check with 4 staff and what looked like a manager behind the bar. Speaks for itself
Great beer, great staff. We tried a bunch of new beers on the menu. They certainly did not disappoint. Would recommend anyone to try

Good snack and foods here..
nice outdoor with fan , very relaxing with my drink

Definitely recommend
Great Ambiance & beer. Terrible food though.
Great little place with good food and friendly staff. Definitely a place to come back to and the have Blanton's if your interested.
Nice brunch menu and atmosphere.
Great atmosphere, great food, and even better beer!

This place is pretty cool I like the vibe, beers were good but I have to say, probably the worst  burger I've ever had. I ordered the tsp burger and it sounded so bomb it even looked great....but it had zero flavor it was so bland. The fries were delicious though.
Great environment... Great selection of beers!

This was a cool bar. Nothing made it stand out honestly. Signature drinks were delicious but pretty pricey, but common in south end area. The beers were priced well. Outside seating was cool and live music was a vibe
This place has a great vibe, food is amazing and a tremendous choice of drinks.

Brewery, pub, restaurant, cafe anchoring south end's renaissance. Well designed place with loads of outdoor space. Beer is very good - it has to be in a solid beer town like Charlotte. Food is excellent too. Dogs welcome outside. Lots of local young professionals hang here, but it's an attraction for the area itself. Tip: If you sit outside and use the app to order, remember to order a little at a time because everything on each submission will come together.
Shovel flag; go get it!

Went with a small group and we each ordered from different bartenders (ordering at different times) and they were all either unknowledgeable, unfriendly, or just plain rude. They had no well bourbon so the guy tried to tell me that Jim Beam was a Tennessee whiskey. Everyone in our group agreed that the drinks were extremely weak.

I've had better experiences there for lunch, but last night really soured my opinion of this place.
A great place to have a drink and food for a birthday dinner. We went here with a reservation, got right in. The atmosphere is nice and there are plenty of options on the menu. Highly recommended!
Dope spot...lots of different margaritas
surprisingly at a place where you think beer might be your go to drink, this place serves amazing cocktails also... the outdoor seating was fun with beautiful lights and ambience

My husband and I came across Suffolk Punch Brewing on TikTok. The location was easy to find since we are familiar with the area and don't live to far from it. After looking the menu online I knew we had to check them out because I'm always down to have a mimosa. Lol.  We wasn't able to make it to brunch but the lunch was good. Suffolk Punch is a real vibe. The service was fast and reliable. Along with the food and drinks. I will be going back for brunch because the feedback I was getting was telling me everything I wanted to hear.

Met with a few friends for brunch on a Sunday after hearing rave reviews about Suffolk Punch. The environment of the back patio reminded me of a busy cafeteria- loud, hot mayhem. Service was not particularly memorable as you had to scan a QR code and order from your phone- someone would later drop off your order with minimal acknowledgement. I mention this because the brunch wasn't cheap and patrons are often times going to restaurants such as these in part for the experience. The food itself was decent, but nothing I'd return for. The drinks looked like something you might order at a beach bar- no care really taken in making them. Sadly, I don't know that'd return. At least not on a Sunday afternoon.

Absolutely loved our food. Jonika was an amazing waitress and made sure to check on us several times even being the only customers. The MARGHERITA  was phenomenal. Cut like butter and melted in your mouth like that too. Overall would rate the service and food 10/5 Stars!!! New local favorite!! Thanks so much for all you help..

We stopped here on our way to Roanoke VA from Atlanta and it was worth the time. Lots of seating both indoor and out with easy ordering on your phone. Saturday is brunch till 3 and we had the pretzel, burger, fries and Mac&cheese. Food was tasty and the variety of beer did not disappoint. Parking was a little tight but there's plenty of street side parking in the area.
Good food and good beers. Enjoyed the ambience.
I enjoyed visiting here. It had a really nice seating inside and outside for your needs. The server did a good job and the food and drinks were great. I will definitely visit again.

We had a decent experience despite a rude employee. (Seems rude to seat us and give the impression they'll be right back - only to notice them eating a meal at the bar - and way after that asking someone else to take over our table). The space is attractive. The barware/glassware is beautiful! The Pulp Prescription IPA delicious. Good veggie burger. And look, I do not like to say anything negative - ever, but it wasn't a busy time and we were thirsty, friendly vacationers ready to go the whole way and buy merch and shout praises and all that... but...
Our first time here and it did not disappoint. A very lively place and fantastic food. We ordered a Cappuccino, Huevos Rancheros, Chicken Biscuit
Damn good food and beer!

We came for the first time Sunday for brunch and absolutely enjoyed the ambience, food and experience. Our server was very knowledgeable, attentive, and he was absolutely FUNNY(hate I don't remember his name). We all shared the French toast that were muffin tops, chicken biscuit sandwich that is extremely HUGE and the devil eggs! Cocktails were amazing. We definitely will be back to grab some dinner and lunch soon!

When helped at the door, the cashier wasn't attentive and not helpful with the menu. After we ordered there wasn't good communication at all. We sat down but then were told to sit outside. We sit outside, and someone tells us, you have to get your drinks inside. We then went to get our drinks, and the bartenders ignored us immediately then got an attitude because we didn't hear them calling our name but again weren't told how it works at this restaurant. We went to pay and were ignored again but then asked how can I help you with a horrible tone of voice and tossed the receipt. I will never come here or recommend this place to anyone.
Had lunch there today- the tacos were unbelievable! Charming atmosphere- I highly recommend this place!

This place was incredible, the beer selections are great, absolutely fell for a good amount of them. My partner and I tried a few flights and honestly this brewery is one of my favorites now. The food is amazing and found the staff to be wonderful, they were super accommodating of any questions we had. Large space indoor and out. 10/10 coming back.

Food was amazing. Deon and the bartender w the tattoo sleeve are stellar. Thank goodness they stepped up after sitting with no service.  Service is dependent if you get a bartender actually willing to serve the minority demographic.

The staff is ultra friendly and knowledgeable. We didn't wait long for anything we ordered. The food was fantastic! All the beer was good I liked everything picked for the flights. I want to come back for brunch, and in warmer weather. It's a stunning location as well.
Huge, cool indoor/outdoor space. Brunch was great! Coffee drinks and beer were both delicious and I'll probably have dreams about the chicken biscuit
Great food, great service it is really cold inside. Needs better heating system. Everyone in the restaurant had their jacket on and people were talking about it.
Great place to hangout with friends, even on a weekday evening. Food and beer is great! Buffalo Cauliflower dip was the best!!
Great place! Perfect for brunch.

This was our first time at this brewery. Parking was hard to find but it could be due to how popular this place is on Saturday's. We were seated immediately and ordered about 5 mins later. Our waitress was very attentive. The food came out within 5 mins with excellent portions sizes. Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a chill vibe, good food and excellent service. We will definitely be back!
Awesome little Brewery. Wide selection of beer and some good eats to go along with it.

Had a great time at Suffolk Punch in Charlotte. I went on a Thursday night and they had a selection of draft beers that were $3. We had brussel sprouts as an app. They came out on 30 seconds and were cold. They still were good. I had the BBQ chicken nachos. The bbq chicken was really good and the nachos had tons of cheese and toppings. Would definitely order that again. The service was really good too! Looking forward to going back!
Awesome vibe, great selection of beer and delicious food

I would not return based on the lack of cleanliness I observed on my recent visit. I was seated near the kitchen and had a perfect view of the area food is picked up from and delivered to tables. I observed a few of the women playing with/adjusting their hair and then grabbing plates to deliver it to tables. I observed one man that took his hat off adjusted it and put it back on right over the food holding area. These individuals did not wash or sanitize at all. The servers are responsible for adding fries that are held in a bowl to the plates. Because of their lack of cleanliness this was not well received. My food was just ok. My fries were overcooked and just warm. My burger appeared to have unknown particles, thinner than hair so I don't think that's what is was. My friend described her French toast muffin as very bad and something they should rework. It completely fell apart and was very soggy. Our server was nice but the hostess instructed us to wait at the to go ordering area. When someone came he told us to go to the hostess stand. She then said she thought we were ordering to go, not sure why she assumed that or at the least just asked. The best part was the cold brew cocktails, they were very good but would not make me return. Glad I went, now I know.
